H0.text: If all of the atoms were removed from a chair, the chair would still be there but it would weigh less.

H1.text: The chair would be exactly the same as it was before if you took all of the atoms out of it.

H2.text: There would be nothing left of the chair if all of its atoms were removed.

H3.text: Only a pool of liquid would be left on the floor if you took all of the atoms out of a chair.

A4.text: Atoms are the basic particles of the chemical elements and the fundamental building blocks of matter.

A5.text: Atoms can attach to one or more other atoms by chemical bonds to form chemical compounds such as molecules or crystals.
